While sketching out and thinking through some code for a project, I am reminded again how hard it is make things simple. I have a natural tendency to over complicate code when I am developing. Call it over engineering, over thinking, thinking too much; whatever you tag it with, I seem to be plagued by it.

Here are a few things I try to do to make development simple.

Break everything down to the smallest possible task
Take the largest of tasks and break them down to very small manageable tasks, and concentrate on those smaller tasks.

Pseudo-code everything
I prefer to pseudo-code just about everything. This helps me in a few ways.

  • It helps me catch logical errors before they end up in code and become harder to find.  
  • It allows me to think about the methods that I may need to complete the task. I am usually working with some sort of API so this often helps me dig through the docs for the best solution.

Worth noting that I don’t get crazy with the pseudo-code, just get the steps involved down on paper so I can see what is going on.

Take a lot of short breaks
These little breaks bring me back to reality when I start to over-complicate the problem that is trying to be solved. These breaks often involve a “duh” moment.
